oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: I Heard My Name On The Radio - King's Sacred Quartet performance
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance of I Heard My Name On The Radio, written by Albert Brumley, performed by the King's Sacred Quartet [unconfirmed] which consisted of Johnnie Wright, Jack Anglin, Ray Atkins, and Clyde Moody. Mention of a previous performance with Harmie Smith in Warren, Tex., mention of an upcoming performance with Johnnie & Jack and the Tennessee Mountain Boys and Harmie Smith on at a high school auditorium, and mention of upcoming performance on Friday, January 7th (most likely either 1944 or 1949).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: King's Sacred Quartet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) The King's Sacred Quartet [unconfirmed] performs "I Heard My Name On The Radio" [incomplete] / (1:57) [Unidentified radio announcer] and [Unidentified musician] discuss previous and upcoming performances / (3:16) [Unidentified] performs "[Unidentified song]" [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Brumley, Albert E., 1905-1977; Wright, Johnnie, 1914-2011; Atkins, Ray, 1927-1997; Anglin, Jack, 1916-1963; Moody, Clyde, 1915-1989; Smith, Harmie; Tennessee Mountain Boys
